hi and welcome you listening to the x22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1601 a and today's date is June
26 2018 and the thought of the episode
is the fight to the end
tariffs won't crash world economy
monetary policy will let's get into the
economic collapse financial news now out
in the UK we see that the UK is about to
leave the EU the Speaker of the UK
Parliament House of Commons chamber has
announced that the EU withdrawal bill
that has gone undergone hundreds of
hours of debate well it has been signed
into law by pretty much the lawmakers
and he went on to say that I have to
notify the house in accordance with the
Royal Assent Act of 1967 that Her
Majesty has signified her royal assent
to the following acts European Union
withdrawal Act 2018 Commons Speaker John
Bercow told lawmakers during a session
of the house the UK prime minister
Theresa May called the moment historic
now the EU withdrawal bill enables the
implementation of Britain's exit from
the European Union by repealing the
European communities act of 1972 and
this is the source of the European law
in the UK legislation made by EU
institutions won't affect the UK anymore
with the majority of existing EU laws
becoming domestic UK laws now the
document also upholds the brexit day in
British law as of March 29th 2019 at 11
p.m. defined by the end of the two-year
article 50 withdrawal process so it
looks like the UK is prepared and ready
to remove itself from the EU and I
believe that other countries now are
gonna jump on board with this especially
with the immigration problems and
everything else I think there's gonna be
many other European countries that say
you know something maybe it's time for
us to leave the EU now here in the
United States we see that consumer
confidence well it discipline
in June we see that expectations were
around 128 came in around 120 6.4 and
those people that were looking to
purchase autos major appliances well the
hope of purchasing those type of items
that kind of tumbled but what's very
interesting is that we see the highest
income Americans they're losing
confidence in the system and the
lower-income Americans they're seeing
confidence now soar so we're seeing the
opposite effect right now because maybe
these individuals who aren't making that
much they believe in the future things
are going to get a lot better and those
people that are taking advantage of the
system right now they're looking at it
going ok times up and everything's about
to change we see that that everything's
about the change with Toys R Us in three
days the last Toys R Us store will
completely disappear and this is not the
only brick-and-mortar store and remember
Toys R Us already had an online presence
too they had both but we can see that
this is really hitting hard and it's
affecting a lot of these retailers
because the economy has been doing well
for a very long time it's been getting
worse a lot of stores have been closing
the corporate offices have been closing
and a lot of people have been losing
their jobs actually if we look at Toys R
Us 33,000 employees when everything is
all said and done and everything's done
they will all be out of a job think
about the rest of the retailers not just

start looking for jobs and again if

are they finding these jobs and this has
been the same argument that we've had
for a very long time no they're not all
going to amazon because amazon is a very
small percentage of the entire retail
industry we see that us home prices well
the growth is starting to slow
now we saw this happen back in 2006-2007
where housing prices they hit a peak and
it was the top of the bubble and then
they started coming down not nothing not
everywhere in certain areas this started
to happen I'll give you an example in
New York prices started to come down
very slowly traffic started to dry up
but in Miami in Florida they were still
building speculators were still coming
in this was back in 2006-2007 but when
it hit right after 2008 it hit hard in

is that all of a sudden home prices and
remember the bubble was inflated above
the 2008 housing bubble and now we're
starting to see home prices come down
which means traffic is going to dry up
individuals are gonna have a tougher
time selling their houses and as they
have a tougher time selling their houses
people are going to lose confidence
remember confidence is built up when you
believe you have all this equity in your

when it starts to deflate when the
prices start to come down people lose
that feeling and they feel like they're
losing their money so they tighten up
they don't go out and they spent they
don't go out and spend like they did
they don't take equity lines of credit
out on their homes refinancing is going
to die and we're starting to see home

Washington and many other cities and
these are all the case-shiller 20-city
composite where they look at these
cities and say look housing is doing
fantastically again the central bank was
able to pump the bubbles up in these

we had no plans to limit Chinese

I don't know why minuchin was out there

happened once before where minutia n--
was out there telling the world
something completely different that was
going on actually that Trump was gonna

think basically what Trump is doing
right now is kind of setting him up to

munition is a goldman sachs boy and i
don't believe he's a good guy right now
i think he's on the bad side just like

administration like McMasters
I think Bolton is on that same side with

them in there to keep an eye on all

world economy and we need to take a

fighting this out we understand that the
central banks they're raising the rates
they're tightening right now because
what they did was they created this
gigantic illusion where they have all

real estate and everything else and
they're trying to get rid of it right
now they're raising rates right now to
start the collapse of the system and
again Powell was out there once again
saying that yes he's getting ready to
pop the bubbles
we know that the biz is trying to
separate themselves from the insolvent
banking system and right now we have
this war where the corporate media is
saying that all these tariffs well it's
going to crash the world economy but the
thing is tariffs are not gonna do this
monetary policy will who's in control
the monetary policy that is the central
bank now The Economist magazine put out
this statement rising tariffs are the
worst of many threats to the world
economy because among other things
tariffs temporarily push up inflation
making it harder for central banks to
cushion the blow now this statement
displays a deeply in
Trench confusion if not utter
misunderstanding of some of the basic
economic concepts most important many
people fail to correctly distinguish
between the causes and effects of price
inflation and those of monetary
inflation monetary inflation is the
increase in the quantity of money in the
economy this inflation causes the
purchasing power of money to fall which
brings about price effects a general
rise in prices of goods and services
which we can refer to as price inflation
however this general rise in prices
following monetary inflation is
disproportionate and staggered prices
will rise at different times and to
different extent as money reaches a
lower purchasing power but monetary
inflation also has a non-price effect
one of these is the transfer of wealth
between the last receiver of the new
money toward the first receiver another
and even more important is the
distortion of the pattern of investment
and production as the new money being
created through credit expansion reaches
stock markets and businesses the sort of
artificially reducing the interest rate
this latter effect explains the
occurrence of production booms
misaligned with consumer preferences and
if we just look at the last part of this
what happens is is we have an economic
bust or crash because it's misaligned
with consumer preferences these price
and non price effects of monetary
inflation are general and underline
every possible economic activity trade
tariffs on the other hand affect only
some markets and bring about increases
in some prices in the economy as this
happens our consumption patterns change
if we consume fewer imports prices of
domestic substitutes will rise if our
consumption of imports Rises or does not
change we'll have a reduced income to
spend on other goods whose prices will
now form whatever the result it does not
engender a general rise in prices or a
depreciation of the currency as a result
moreover even if tariffs were applied to
every good and service there would be no
systemic intertemporal distortion of the
structure of production a stalling of
productive activity and a rise in
production costs is likely to occur as
capital goods example like steel or
aluminum will now be more expensive but
capital is not under utilized not
squandered there may be less investment
but no malinvestment so understanding
this it is easier to see than the trade
tariffs as bad as they are cannot
produce an economic bust in the same
sense as it occurs in the business cycle
the worst thing by far for world economy
of interconnected financial and capital
markets is monetary inflation and credit
expansion control by who the central
bank it is never cure and always a curse
trade tariffs are however the second
worst threat to a global market but once
again monetary policy will bring it down
and we can see that there is a push
right now to align the United States
with what is going to happen after the
system comes down so there is a battle
right now and this is why the corporate
media is out there saying all these
towers are gonna destroy the world the
company economy no what they're saying
is that the tariffs are going to destroy
the central banking globalist economy is
very very different because what is
being replaced with all of that is
bilateral trades and a whole new system
of trade and this is why this is being
pushed so hard and again to get to that

it's going to be very difficult in
certain instances and the corporate
media the central banks they're gonna
tell you how bad it is just like with

implode if you leave the EU if you leave
the central banking system your country
will not be able to operate it's all

and what we're seeing right now is
they're gonna continually throw
this out and tell you how bad it's going
to be that this is going to crash the

it's their system that is the main
problem
it's designed to crash it was never
designed to go this long usually 4045
years that's it and it breaks down just
like we're seeing the value of the
dollar decreases there's too much debt
the whole thing just implodes and that's
what we're seeing right now and this is
why Russia China and the rest of the

silver prices and they've been adding

because they understand it's an

from all this manipulation they know the

the people lost out because now the gold
